DataElement.preferredName: Prior Health Assessment SF 36 Item Survey Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Coded response to a question about a person's health now as compared to one year ago.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to an assessment of prior health.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:The state of the organism when it functions optimally without evidence of disease.

Concepts.definition: Refers to a person's state of physical, mental and social well-being; usually it refers specifically to the state of being in good health, a state of complete physical, mental and social well-being, and does not consist only of the absence of disease or infirmity. In any organism health constitutes a form of homeostasis with inputs and outputs of energy and mass in approximate equilibrium allowing for growth and continued survival. In humans, a subjective feeling of well-being coming from somatic and cognitive perceptions is considered an essential component of health.

Property.preferredDefinition: Examination of the body by auscultation, palpation, percussion, inspection, and olfaction.  (Taber's)

Concepts.definition: A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: information on quality of patient life and ability to function

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: In an unchanged or similar condition.

Concepts.definition: The status is unaltered or similar to the previous state.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:The state of the organism when it functions optimally without evidence of disease.:The examination of two or more people or things in order to detect similarities and differences.:A condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: Refers to a person's state of physical, mental and social well-being; usually it refers specifically to the state of being in good health, a state of complete physical, mental and social well-being, and does not consist only of the absence of disease or infirmity. In any organism health constitutes a form of homeostasis with inputs and outputs of energy and mass in approximate equilibrium allowing for growth and continued survival. In humans, a subjective feeling of well-being coming from somatic and cognitive perceptions is considered an essential component of health.
The examination of two or more people or things in order to detect similarities and differences.
A condition or state at a particular time.

ValueDomain.origin: ACOSOG CRF:American College of Surgeons Oncology Group Case Report Form

ReferenceDocuments.name: Compared to one year ago, how
ReferenceDocuments.description: Compared to one year ago, how would you rate your health in general now?
